items.content_html: Have you ever wondered how fortune tellers, astrologers, or our well-known Baba Vanga used to predict future events? Or have you ever questioned whether AI and ML have the capabilities to predict future events as Baba Vanga did? For suppose if AI and ML have the capabilities, then up to how extent can it predict? I am writing this to give answers to these types of questions.

items.content_html: Posted by Ramki Gummadi, Software Engineer, Google and Kevin Chen, Software Engineer, YouTube      Caching is a ubiquitous idea in computer science that significantly improves the performance of storage and retrieval systems by storing a subset of popular items closer to the client based on request patterns. An important algorithmic piece of cache management is the decision policy used for dynamically updating the set of items being stored, which has been extensively optimized over several decad...

items.content_html: Robots are quickly becoming part of our everyday lives, but theyâ€™re often only programmed to perform specific tasks well. While harnessing recent advances in AI could lead to robots that could help in many more ways, progress in building general-purpose robots is slower in part because of the time needed to collect real-world training data.
